title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 09, 2022
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 09, 2022 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Nix
items.content_text:
### DevOps / Discovery

*   [Standard (⭐443)](https://github.com/divnix/std) - An opinionated Nix Flakes framework to keep Nix code in large projects organized, accompanied by a friendly CLI/TUI optized for DevOps scenarios.
items.content_html:
DevOps / Discovery

  • Standard (⭐443) - An opinionated Nix Flakes framework to keep Nix code in large projects organized, accompanied by a friendly CLI/TUI optized for DevOps scenarios.

items.title: Awesome Regression Testing
items.content_text:
### Online services (a-z↓)

*   [testRigor](https://testrigor.com) - E2E functional test automation tool for web, mobile, and desktop tests.
items.content_html:
Online services (a-z↓)

  • testRigor - E2E functional test automation tool for web, mobile, and desktop tests.

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### (requires Neovim 0.5)

*   [neovim/nvim-lspconfig (⭐12k)](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig) - Quickstart configurations for the LSP client.
*   [nvim-lua/lsp-status.nvim (⭐642)](https://github.com/nvim-lua/lsp-status.nvim) - This is a plugin/library for generating statusline components from the built-in LSP client.
*   [onsails/lspkind.nvim (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/onsails/lspkind.nvim) - The plugin adds vscode-like icons to Neovim LSP completions.
*   [gfanto/fzf-lsp.nvim (⭐235)](https://github.com/gfanto/fzf-lsp.nvim) - Enable the power of FZF fuzzy search for the Neovim built in LSP.
*   [ray-x/lsp\_signature.nvim (⭐2.3k)](https://github.com/ray-x/lsp_signature.nvim) - LSP signature hint when you type.
*   [jubnzv/virtual-types.nvim (⭐404)](https://github.com/jubnzv/virtual-types.nvim) - Show type annotations as virtual text.
*   [mfussenegger/nvim-lint (⭐2.4k)](https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-lint) - An asynchronous linter plugin, complementary to the built-in Language Server Protocol support.
*   [b0o/SchemaStore.nvim (⭐868)](https://github.com/b0o/SchemaStore.nvim) - Provide access to the [SchemaStore (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/SchemaStore/schemastore) catalog.
*   [amrbashir/nvim-docs-view (⭐159)](https://github.com/amrbashir/nvim-docs-view) - Display LSP hover documentation in a side panel.
*   [mfussenegger/nvim-jdtls (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-jdtls) - Extensions for the built-in LSP support for eclipse.jdt.ls.
*   [ranjithshegde/ccls.nvim (⭐74)](https://github.com/ranjithshegde/ccls.nvim) - Use off-spec extensions of ccls LSP and browse AST.

### (requires Neovim 0.5) / LSP Installer

*   [williamboman/mason.nvim (⭐9.2k)](https://github.com/williamboman/mason.nvim) - Portable package manager that runs everywhere Neovim runs. Easily install and manage LSP servers, DAP servers, linters, and formatters.

### (requires Neovim 0.5) / Diagnostics

*   [\~whynothugo/lsp\_lines.nvim](https://git.sr.ht/~whynothugo/lsp_lines.nvim) - Render diagnostics using virtual lines on top of the real line of code.

### Programming Languages Support / Diagnostics

*   [Julian/lean.nvim (⭐367)](https://github.com/Julian/lean.nvim) - Neovim support for the [Lean Theorem Prover](https://leanprover.github.io/).
*   [brendalf/mix.nvim (⭐28)](https://github.com/brendalf/mix.nvim) - Mix (from Elixir) wrapper plugin.
*   [AckslD/swenv.nvim (⭐242)](https://github.com/AckslD/swenv.nvim) - Tiny plugin to quickly switch Python virtual environments without restarting.
*   [gennaro-tedesco/nvim-jqx (⭐323)](https://github.com/gennaro-tedesco/nvim-jqx) - Interactive interface for JSON files.
*   [nanotee/sqls.nvim (⭐224)](https://github.com/nanotee/sqls.nvim) - SQL database connection plugin + LSP client.

### Golang / Diagnostics

*   [crusj/structrue-go.nvim (⭐49)](https://github.com/crusj/structrue-go.nvim) - A better structured display of Golang symbols information.
*   [crispgm/nvim-go (⭐150)](https://github.com/crispgm/nvim-go) - A minimal implementation of Golang development plugin.
*   [edolphin-ydf/goimpl.nvim (⭐61)](https://github.com/edolphin-ydf/goimpl.nvim) - Generate interface stubs for a type.
*   [olexsmir/gopher.nvim (⭐364)](https://github.com/olexsmir/gopher.nvim/) - Plugin for making Golang development easiest.
*   [rafaelsq/nvim-goc.lua (⭐50)](https://github.com/rafaelsq/nvim-goc.lua) - Highlight your buffer with Golang Code Coverage.
*   [crusj/hierarchy-tree-go.nvim (⭐34)](https://github.com/crusj/hierarchy-tree-go.nvim) - Neovim plugin for Golang, callHierarchy UI tree.

### Markdown and LaTeX / Diagnostics

*   [jubnzv/mdeval.nvim (⭐212)](https://github.com/jubnzv/mdeval.nvim) - Evaluate code blocks inside markdown documents.
*   [jbyuki/carrot.nvim (⭐26)](https://github.com/jbyuki/carrot.nvim) - Markdown evaluator Lua code blocks.

### Snippet / Diagnostics

*   [L3MON4D3/LuaSnip (⭐4k)](https://github.com/L3MON4D3/LuaSnip) - A snippet engine written in Lua.

### Fuzzy Finder / Diagnostics

*   [vijaymarupudi/nvim-fzf (⭐347)](https://github.com/vijaymarupudi/nvim-fzf) - A Lua API for using FZF (Neovim >= 0.5). Allows for full asynchronicity for UI speed and usability.

### File Explorer / Diagnostics

*   [TimUntersberger/neofs (⭐69)](https://github.com/TimUntersberger/neofs) - A file manager written in Lua.
*   [kevinhwang91/rnvimr (⭐837)](https://github.com/kevinhwang91/rnvimr) - A simple yet amazing file explorer.
*   [ms-jpq/chadtree (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/ms-jpq/chadtree) - File manager. Better than NERDTree.
*   [is0n/fm-nvim (⭐280)](https://github.com/is0n/fm-nvim) - Neovim plugin that lets you use your favorite terminal file managers (and fuzzy finders).
*   [elihunter173/dirbuf.nvim (⭐447)](https://github.com/elihunter173/dirbuf.nvim) - A file manager which lets you edit your filesystem like you edit text.
*   [SidOfc/carbon.nvim (⭐181)](https://github.com/SidOfc/carbon.nvim) - The simple directory tree viewer written in Lua.

### Tree-sitter Supported Colorscheme / Diagnostics

*   [Mofiqul/vscode.nvim (⭐839)](https://github.com/Mofiqul/vscode.nvim) - A Lua port of vim-code-dark colorscheme with vscode light and dark theme.
*   [kyazdani42/blue-moon (⭐253)](https://github.com/kyazdani42/blue-moon) - A dark color scheme derived from palenight and carbonight.
*   [mhartington/oceanic-next (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/mhartington/oceanic-next) - Oceanic Next theme.
*   [rockerBOO/boo-colorscheme-nvim (⭐221)](https://github.com/rockerBOO/boo-colorscheme-nvim) - A colorscheme with handcrafted support for LSP, Tree-sitter.
*   [bkegley/gloombuddy (⭐46)](https://github.com/bkegley/gloombuddy) - Gloom inspired theme.
*   [Th3Whit3Wolf/one-nvim (⭐111)](https://github.com/Th3Whit3Wolf/one-nvim) - An Atom One inspired dark and light colorscheme.
*   [Th3Whit3Wolf/space-nvim (⭐49)](https://github.com/Th3Whit3Wolf/space-nvim) - A spacemacs inspired dark and light colorscheme.
*   [tanvirtin/monokai.nvim (⭐371)](https://github.com/tanvirtin/monokai.nvim) - Monokai theme written in Lua.
*   [ishan9299/nvim-solarized-lua (⭐196)](https://github.com/ishan9299/nvim-solarized-lua) - Solarized colorscheme in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5).
*   [navarasu/onedark.nvim (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/navarasu/onedark.nvim) - A One Dark Theme (Neovim >= 0.5) written in Lua based on Atom's One Dark Theme.
*   [NTBBloodbath/doom-one.nvim (⭐233)](https://github.com/NTBBloodbath/doom-one.nvim) - Lua port of doom-emacs' doom-one.
*   [projekt0n/github-nvim-theme (⭐2.3k)](https://github.com/projekt0n/github-nvim-theme) - A GitHub theme, kitty, alacritty written in Lua. Support built-in LSP and Tree-sitter.
*   [FrenzyExists/aquarium-vim (⭐304)](https://github.com/FrenzyExists/aquarium-vim) - A dark, yet vibrant colorscheme.
*   [kvrohit/substrata.nvim (⭐139)](https://github.com/kvrohit/substrata.nvim) - A cold, dark color scheme written in Lua ported from [arzg/vim-substrata (⭐203)](https://github.com/arzg/vim-substrata) theme.
*   [tiagovla/tokyodark.nvim (⭐543)](https://github.com/tiagovla/tokyodark.nvim) - A clean dark theme written in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5) and above.
*   [cpea2506/one\_monokai.nvim (⭐182)](https://github.com/cpea2506/one_monokai.nvim) - One Monokai theme written in Lua.
*   [kvrohit/rasmus.nvim (⭐181)](https://github.com/kvrohit/rasmus.nvim) - A dark color scheme written in Lua ported from [rsms/sublime-theme (⭐206)](https://github.com/rsms/sublime-theme) theme.

### Lua Colorscheme / Diagnostics

*   [metalelf0/jellybeans-nvim (⭐121)](https://github.com/metalelf0/jellybeans-nvim) - A port of jellybeans colorscheme.
*   [lalitmee/cobalt2.nvim (⭐111)](https://github.com/lalitmee/cobalt2.nvim) - A port of cobalt2 colorscheme using colorbuddy.

### Colorscheme Creation / Diagnostics

*   [norcalli/nvim-base16.lua (⭐76)](https://github.com/norcalli/nvim-base16.lua) - Programmatic Lua library for setting base16 themes.

### Bars and Lines / Diagnostics

*   [SmiteshP/nvim-navic (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/SmiteshP/nvim-navic) - A simple statusline/winbar component that uses LSP to show your current code context.

### Statusline / Diagnostics

*   [adelarsq/neoline.vim (⭐252)](https://github.com/adelarsq/neoline.vim) - A light statusline/tabline plugin using Lua.
*   [beauwilliams/statusline.lua (⭐238)](https://github.com/beauwilliams/statusline.lua) - A zero-config minimal statusline written in Lua featuring awesome integrations and blazing speed!
*   [tamton-aquib/staline.nvim (⭐386)](https://github.com/tamton-aquib/staline.nvim) - A modern lightweight statusline in Lua. Mainly uses unicode symbols for showing info.
*   [windwp/windline.nvim (⭐491)](https://github.com/windwp/windline.nvim) - The next generation statusline. Animation statusline.

### Tabline / Diagnostics

*   [akinsho/bufferline.nvim (⭐3.9k)](https://github.com/akinsho/bufferline.nvim) - A snazzy buffer line built using Lua.
*   [johann2357/nvim-smartbufs (⭐46)](https://github.com/johann2357/nvim-smartbufs) - Smart buffer management.

### Startup / Diagnostics

*   [goolord/alpha-nvim (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/goolord/alpha-nvim) - A fast and highly customizable greeter like [vim-startify (⭐5.4k)](https://github.com/mhinz/vim-startify)/dashboard-nvim.

### Media / Diagnostics

*   [andweeb/presence.nvim (⭐915)](https://github.com/andweeb/presence.nvim) - Fast and lite Discord Rich Presence plugin written in Lua.
*   [Chaitanyabsrip/present.nvim (⭐154)](https://github.com/Chaitanyabsprip/present.nvim) - A Presentation plugin written in Lua.

### Note Taking / Diagnostics

*   [0styx0/abbreinder.nvim (⭐92)](https://github.com/0styx0/abbreinder.nvim) - Abbreviation reminders (Neovim >= 0.5).
*   [jbyuki/nabla.nvim (⭐696)](https://github.com/jbyuki/nabla.nvim) - Take your scientific notes.
*   [nvim-neorg/neorg (⭐6.9k)](https://github.com/nvim-neorg/neorg) - Modernity meets insane extensibility. The future of organizing your life.
*   [nvim-orgmode/orgmode (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/nvim-orgmode/orgmode) - Orgmode clone written in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5).
*   [jbyuki/venn.nvim (⭐1.1k)](https://github.com/jbyuki/venn.nvim) - Draw ASCII diagrams.
*   [chrsm/impulse.nvim (⭐99)](https://github.com/chrsm/impulse.nvim) - Read Notion.so notes.

### Utility / Diagnostics

*   [rcarriga/nvim-notify (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/rcarriga/nvim-notify) - A fancy, configurable, notification manager.
*   [toppair/reach.nvim (⭐245)](https://github.com/toppair/reach.nvim) - Buffer, mark, tabpage switcher.
*   [kevinhwang91/nvim-ufo (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/kevinhwang91/nvim-ufo) - Ultra fold with modern looking and performance boosting.
*   [nguyenvukhang/nvim-toggler (⭐170)](https://github.com/nguyenvukhang/nvim-toggler) - Invert text, such as toggling between `true` and `false`.
*   [jbyuki/instant.nvim (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/jbyuki/instant.nvim) - A collaborative editing plugin written in Lua with no dependencies.

### Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

*   [norcalli/nvim-terminal.lua (⭐244)](https://github.com/norcalli/nvim-terminal.lua) - A high performance filetype mode which leverages conceal and highlights your buffer with the correct color codes.
*   [pianocomposer321/consolation.nvim (⭐35)](https://github.com/pianocomposer321/consolation.nvim) - A general-purpose terminal wrapper and management plugin, written in Lua.
*   [jlesquembre/nterm.nvim (⭐56)](https://github.com/jlesquembre/nterm.nvim) - Interact with the terminal, with notifications.

### Debugging / Diagnostics

*   [mfussenegger/nvim-dap (⭐6.5k)](https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap) - Debug Adapter Protocol client implementation.
*   [andrewferrier/debugprint.nvim (⭐480)](https://github.com/andrewferrier/debugprint.nvim) - Debugging the print() way.

### Test / Diagnostics

*   [David-Kunz/jester (⭐210)](https://github.com/David-Kunz/jester) - Easily run and debug Jest tests.

### Code Runner / Diagnostics

*   [is0n/jaq-nvim (⭐178)](https://github.com/is0n/jaq-nvim) - Just Another Quickrun Plugin in Lua.

### Neovim Lua Development / Diagnostics

*   [nvim-lua/popup.nvim (⭐395)](https://github.com/nvim-lua/popup.nvim) - An implementation of the Popup API from Vim.
*   [bfredl/nvim-luadev (⭐281)](https://github.com/bfredl/nvim-luadev) - REPL/debug console Lua plugins. The `:Luadev` command will open an scratch window which will show output from executing Lua code.
*   [MunifTanjim/nui.nvim (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/MunifTanjim/nui.nvim) - UI Component Library.
*   [milisims/nvim-luaref (⭐124)](https://github.com/milisims/nvim-luaref) - A reference for builtin Lua functions.
*   [anuvyklack/animation.nvim (⭐46)](https://github.com/anuvyklack/animation.nvim) - Create animations.

### Fennel / Diagnostics

*   [Olical/conjure (⭐2k)](https://github.com/Olical/conjure) - Interactive evaluation (Clojure, Fennel, Janet, Racket, Hy, MIT Scheme, Guile).

### Git / Diagnostics

*   [kdheepak/lazygit.nvim (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/kdheepak/lazygit.nvim) - Plugin for calling lazygit.
*   [akinsho/git-conflict.nvim (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/akinsho/git-conflict.nvim) - A plugin to visualise and resolve merge conflicts.

### GitHub / Diagnostics

*   [ldelossa/gh.nvim (⭐588)](https://github.com/ldelossa/gh.nvim) - A fully featured GitHub integration for performing code reviews.

### Keybinding / Diagnostics

*   [mrjones2014/legendary.nvim (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/mrjones2014/legendary.nvim) - Define your keymaps, commands, and autocommands as simple Lua tables, and create a legend for them at the same time (like VS Code's Command Palette), integrates with `which-key.nvim`.

### Mouse / Diagnostics

*   [notomo/gesture.nvim (⭐529)](https://github.com/notomo/gesture.nvim) - Mouse gesture plugin.

### Scrolling / Diagnostics

*   [karb94/neoscroll.nvim (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/karb94/neoscroll.nvim) - Smooth scrolling.
*   [declancm/cinnamon.nvim (⭐383)](https://github.com/declancm/cinnamon.nvim) - Smooth scrolling for any movement command.

### Scrollbar / Diagnostics

*   [Xuyuanp/scrollbar.nvim (⭐278)](https://github.com/Xuyuanp/scrollbar.nvim) - Scrollbar.
*   [dstein64/nvim-scrollview (⭐633)](https://github.com/dstein64/nvim-scrollview) - Display interactive scrollbars.

### Editing Support / Diagnostics

*   [windwp/nvim-autopairs (⭐3.7k)](https://github.com/windwp/nvim-autopairs) - A minimalist autopairs written by Lua.
*   [ZhiyuanLck/smart-pairs (⭐135)](https://github.com/ZhiyuanLck/smart-pairs) - Ultimate smart pairs written by Lua.
*   [m4xshen/autoclose.nvim (⭐590)](https://github.com/m4xshen/autoclose.nvim) - A minimalist autoclose plugin written in Lua.
*   [folke/zen-mode.nvim (⭐2k)](https://github.com/folke/zen-mode.nvim) - Distraction-free coding.
*   [smjonas/live-command.nvim (⭐528)](https://github.com/smjonas/live-command.nvim) - Text editing with immediate visual feedback: preview commands such as `:norm`, `:g`, macros and more.
*   [filipdutescu/renamer.nvim (⭐311)](https://github.com/filipdutescu/renamer.nvim) - VS Code-like renaming UI, written in Lua.
*   [gbprod/yanky.nvim (⭐1.1k)](https://github.com/gbprod/yanky.nvim) - Improved Yank and Put functionalities.

### Comment / Diagnostics

*   [numToStr/Comment.nvim (⭐4.3k)](https://github.com/numToStr/Comment.nvim) - Smart and Powerful comment plugin. Supports commentstring, motions, dot-repeat and more.
*   [terrortylor/nvim-comment (⭐491)](https://github.com/terrortylor/nvim-comment) - Toggle comments using the built-in commentstring option.

### Formatting / Diagnostics

*   [gpanders/editorconfig.nvim (⭐325)](https://github.com/gpanders/editorconfig.nvim) - An EditorConfig plugin written in Fennel.
*   [mhartington/formatter.nvim (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/mhartington/formatter.nvim) - A format runner written in Lua.
*   [MunifTanjim/prettier.nvim (⭐305)](https://github.com/MunifTanjim/prettier.nvim) - Prettier integration.

### Indent / Diagnostics

*   [NMAC427/guess-indent.nvim (⭐517)](https://github.com/NMAC427/guess-indent.nvim) - Automatic indentation style detection.
*   [Darazaki/indent-o-matic (⭐195)](https://github.com/Darazaki/indent-o-matic) - Dumb automatic fast indentation detection written in Lua.
*   [yaocccc/nvim-hlchunk (⭐53)](https://github.com/yaocccc/nvim-hlchunk) - Highlight a `{}` chunk.

### Session / Diagnostics

*   [rmagatti/auto-session (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/rmagatti/auto-session) - A small automated session manager.

### Tmux / Diagnostics

*   [aserowy/tmux.nvim (⭐738)](https://github.com/aserowy/tmux.nvim) - Tmux integration features pane movement and resizing.

### Boilerplate / Diagnostics

*   [gennaro-tedesco/boilit (⭐83)](https://github.com/gennaro-tedesco/boilit) - Create boilerplate structure plugins.

### Resource / Diagnostics

*   [Neovimcraft](https://neovimcraft.com) - A site dedicated to searching specific plugins and guides for building plugins in Lua.
items.content_html:
(requires Neovim 0.5)

  • neovim/nvim-lspconfig (⭐12k) - Quickstart configurations for the LSP client.
  • nvim-lua/lsp-status.nvim (⭐642) - This is a plugin/library for generating statusline components from the built-in LSP client.
  • onsails/lspkind.nvim (⭐1.6k) - The plugin adds vscode-like icons to Neovim LSP completions.
  • gfanto/fzf-lsp.nvim (⭐235) - Enable the power of FZF fuzzy search for the Neovim built in LSP.
  • ray-x/lsp_signature.nvim (⭐2.3k) - LSP signature hint when you type.
  • jubnzv/virtual-types.nvim (⭐404) - Show type annotations as virtual text.
  • mfussenegger/nvim-lint (⭐2.4k) - An asynchronous linter plugin, complementary to the built-in Language Server Protocol support.
  • b0o/SchemaStore.nvim (⭐868) - Provide access to the SchemaStore (⭐3.4k) catalog.
  • amrbashir/nvim-docs-view (⭐159) - Display LSP hover documentation in a side panel.
  • mfussenegger/nvim-jdtls (⭐1.3k) - Extensions for the built-in LSP support for eclipse.jdt.ls.
  • ranjithshegde/ccls.nvim (⭐74) - Use off-spec extensions of ccls LSP and browse AST.

(requires Neovim 0.5) / LSP Installer

  • williamboman/mason.nvim (⭐9.2k) - Portable package manager that runs everywhere Neovim runs. Easily install and manage LSP servers, DAP servers, linters, and formatters.

(requires Neovim 0.5) / Diagnostics

  • ~whynothugo/lsp_lines.nvim - Render diagnostics using virtual lines on top of the real line of code.

Programming Languages Support / Diagnostics

  • Julian/lean.nvim (⭐367) - Neovim support for the Lean Theorem Prover.
  • brendalf/mix.nvim (⭐28) - Mix (from Elixir) wrapper plugin.
  • AckslD/swenv.nvim (⭐242) - Tiny plugin to quickly switch Python virtual environments without restarting.
  • gennaro-tedesco/nvim-jqx (⭐323) - Interactive interface for JSON files.
  • nanotee/sqls.nvim (⭐224) - SQL database connection plugin + LSP client.

Golang / Diagnostics

  • crusj/structrue-go.nvim (⭐49) - A better structured display of Golang symbols information.
  • crispgm/nvim-go (⭐150) - A minimal implementation of Golang development plugin.
  • edolphin-ydf/goimpl.nvim (⭐61) - Generate interface stubs for a type.
  • olexsmir/gopher.nvim (⭐364) - Plugin for making Golang development easiest.
  • rafaelsq/nvim-goc.lua (⭐50) - Highlight your buffer with Golang Code Coverage.
  • crusj/hierarchy-tree-go.nvim (⭐34) - Neovim plugin for Golang, callHierarchy UI tree.

Markdown and LaTeX / Diagnostics

  • jubnzv/mdeval.nvim (⭐212) - Evaluate code blocks inside markdown documents.
  • jbyuki/carrot.nvim (⭐26) - Markdown evaluator Lua code blocks.

Snippet / Diagnostics

  • L3MON4D3/LuaSnip (⭐4k) - A snippet engine written in Lua.

Fuzzy Finder / Diagnostics

  • vijaymarupudi/nvim-fzf (⭐347) - A Lua API for using FZF (Neovim >= 0.5). Allows for full asynchronicity for UI speed and usability.

File Explorer / Diagnostics

  • TimUntersberger/neofs (⭐69) - A file manager written in Lua.
  • kevinhwang91/rnvimr (⭐837) - A simple yet amazing file explorer.
  • ms-jpq/chadtree (⭐1.7k) - File manager. Better than NERDTree.
  • is0n/fm-nvim (⭐280) - Neovim plugin that lets you use your favorite terminal file managers (and fuzzy finders).
  • elihunter173/dirbuf.nvim (⭐447) - A file manager which lets you edit your filesystem like you edit text.
  • SidOfc/carbon.nvim (⭐181) - The simple directory tree viewer written in Lua.

Tree-sitter Supported Colorscheme / Diagnostics

  • Mofiqul/vscode.nvim (⭐839) - A Lua port of vim-code-dark colorscheme with vscode light and dark theme.
  • kyazdani42/blue-moon (⭐253) - A dark color scheme derived from palenight and carbonight.
  • mhartington/oceanic-next (⭐1.2k) - Oceanic Next theme.
  • rockerBOO/boo-colorscheme-nvim (⭐221) - A colorscheme with handcrafted support for LSP, Tree-sitter.
  • bkegley/gloombuddy (⭐46) - Gloom inspired theme.
  • Th3Whit3Wolf/one-nvim (⭐111) - An Atom One inspired dark and light colorscheme.
  • Th3Whit3Wolf/space-nvim (⭐49) - A spacemacs inspired dark and light colorscheme.
  • tanvirtin/monokai.nvim (⭐371) - Monokai theme written in Lua.
  • ishan9299/nvim-solarized-lua (⭐196) - Solarized colorscheme in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5).
  • navarasu/onedark.nvim (⭐1.8k) - A One Dark Theme (Neovim >= 0.5) written in Lua based on Atom's One Dark Theme.
  • NTBBloodbath/doom-one.nvim (⭐233) - Lua port of doom-emacs' doom-one.
  • projekt0n/github-nvim-theme (⭐2.3k) - A GitHub theme, kitty, alacritty written in Lua. Support built-in LSP and Tree-sitter.
  • FrenzyExists/aquarium-vim (⭐304) - A dark, yet vibrant colorscheme.
  • kvrohit/substrata.nvim (⭐139) - A cold, dark color scheme written in Lua ported from arzg/vim-substrata (⭐203) theme.
  • tiagovla/tokyodark.nvim (⭐543) - A clean dark theme written in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5) and above.
  • cpea2506/one_monokai.nvim (⭐182) - One Monokai theme written in Lua.
  • kvrohit/rasmus.nvim (⭐181) - A dark color scheme written in Lua ported from rsms/sublime-theme (⭐206) theme.

Lua Colorscheme / Diagnostics

  • metalelf0/jellybeans-nvim (⭐121) - A port of jellybeans colorscheme.
  • lalitmee/cobalt2.nvim (⭐111) - A port of cobalt2 colorscheme using colorbuddy.

Colorscheme Creation / Diagnostics

  • norcalli/nvim-base16.lua (⭐76) - Programmatic Lua library for setting base16 themes.

Bars and Lines / Diagnostics

  • SmiteshP/nvim-navic (⭐1.6k) - A simple statusline/winbar component that uses LSP to show your current code context.

Statusline / Diagnostics

  • adelarsq/neoline.vim (⭐252) - A light statusline/tabline plugin using Lua.
  • beauwilliams/statusline.lua (⭐238) - A zero-config minimal statusline written in Lua featuring awesome integrations and blazing speed!
  • tamton-aquib/staline.nvim (⭐386) - A modern lightweight statusline in Lua. Mainly uses unicode symbols for showing info.
  • windwp/windline.nvim (⭐491) - The next generation statusline. Animation statusline.

Tabline / Diagnostics

  • akinsho/bufferline.nvim (⭐3.9k) - A snazzy buffer line built using Lua.
  • johann2357/nvim-smartbufs (⭐46) - Smart buffer management.

Startup / Diagnostics

  • goolord/alpha-nvim (⭐2.2k) - A fast and highly customizable greeter like vim-startify (⭐5.4k)/dashboard-nvim.

Media / Diagnostics

  • andweeb/presence.nvim (⭐915) - Fast and lite Discord Rich Presence plugin written in Lua.
  • Chaitanyabsrip/present.nvim (⭐154) - A Presentation plugin written in Lua.

Note Taking / Diagnostics

  • 0styx0/abbreinder.nvim (⭐92) - Abbreviation reminders (Neovim >= 0.5).
  • jbyuki/nabla.nvim (⭐696) - Take your scientific notes.
  • nvim-neorg/neorg (⭐6.9k) - Modernity meets insane extensibility. The future of organizing your life.
  • nvim-orgmode/orgmode (⭐3.4k) - Orgmode clone written in Lua (Neovim >= 0.5).
  • jbyuki/venn.nvim (⭐1.1k) - Draw ASCII diagrams.
  • chrsm/impulse.nvim (⭐99) - Read Notion.so notes.

Utility / Diagnostics

  • rcarriga/nvim-notify (⭐3.4k) - A fancy, configurable, notification manager.
  • toppair/reach.nvim (⭐245) - Buffer, mark, tabpage switcher.
  • kevinhwang91/nvim-ufo (⭐2.7k) - Ultra fold with modern looking and performance boosting.
  • nguyenvukhang/nvim-toggler (⭐170) - Invert text, such as toggling between true and false.
  • jbyuki/instant.nvim (⭐1.4k) - A collaborative editing plugin written in Lua with no dependencies.

Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

  • norcalli/nvim-terminal.lua (⭐244) - A high performance filetype mode which leverages conceal and highlights your buffer with the correct color codes.
  • pianocomposer321/consolation.nvim (⭐35) - A general-purpose terminal wrapper and management plugin, written in Lua.
  • jlesquembre/nterm.nvim (⭐56) - Interact with the terminal, with notifications.

Debugging / Diagnostics

  • mfussenegger/nvim-dap (⭐6.5k) - Debug Adapter Protocol client implementation.
  • andrewferrier/debugprint.nvim (⭐480) - Debugging the print() way.

Test / Diagnostics

  • David-Kunz/jester (⭐210) - Easily run and debug Jest tests.

Code Runner / Diagnostics

  • is0n/jaq-nvim (⭐178) - Just Another Quickrun Plugin in Lua.

Neovim Lua Development / Diagnostics

  • nvim-lua/popup.nvim (⭐395) - An implementation of the Popup API from Vim.
  • bfredl/nvim-luadev (⭐281) - REPL/debug console Lua plugins. The :Luadev command will open an scratch window which will show output from executing Lua code.
  • MunifTanjim/nui.nvim (⭐1.9k) - UI Component Library.
  • milisims/nvim-luaref (⭐124) - A reference for builtin Lua functions.
  • anuvyklack/animation.nvim (⭐46) - Create animations.

Fennel / Diagnostics

  • Olical/conjure (⭐2k) - Interactive evaluation (Clojure, Fennel, Janet, Racket, Hy, MIT Scheme, Guile).

Git / Diagnostics

  • kdheepak/lazygit.nvim (⭐1.9k) - Plugin for calling lazygit.
  • akinsho/git-conflict.nvim (⭐1.2k) - A plugin to visualise and resolve merge conflicts.

GitHub / Diagnostics

  • ldelossa/gh.nvim (⭐588) - A fully featured GitHub integration for performing code reviews.

Keybinding / Diagnostics

  • mrjones2014/legendary.nvim (⭐1.2k) - Define your keymaps, commands, and autocommands as simple Lua tables, and create a legend for them at the same time (like VS Code's Command Palette), integrates with which-key.nvim.

Mouse / Diagnostics

  • notomo/gesture.nvim (⭐529) - Mouse gesture plugin.

Scrolling / Diagnostics

  • karb94/neoscroll.nvim (⭐1.8k) - Smooth scrolling.
  • declancm/cinnamon.nvim (⭐383) - Smooth scrolling for any movement command.

Scrollbar / Diagnostics

  • Xuyuanp/scrollbar.nvim (⭐278) - Scrollbar.
  • dstein64/nvim-scrollview (⭐633) - Display interactive scrollbars.

Editing Support / Diagnostics

  • windwp/nvim-autopairs (⭐3.7k) - A minimalist autopairs written by Lua.
  • ZhiyuanLck/smart-pairs (⭐135) - Ultimate smart pairs written by Lua.
  • m4xshen/autoclose.nvim (⭐590) - A minimalist autoclose plugin written in Lua.
  • folke/zen-mode.nvim (⭐2k) - Distraction-free coding.
  • smjonas/live-command.nvim (⭐528) - Text editing with immediate visual feedback: preview commands such as :norm, :g, macros and more.
  • filipdutescu/renamer.nvim (⭐311) - VS Code-like renaming UI, written in Lua.
  • gbprod/yanky.nvim (⭐1.1k) - Improved Yank and Put functionalities.

Comment / Diagnostics

  • numToStr/Comment.nvim (⭐4.3k) - Smart and Powerful comment plugin. Supports commentstring, motions, dot-repeat and more.
  • terrortylor/nvim-comment (⭐491) - Toggle comments using the built-in commentstring option.

Formatting / Diagnostics

  • gpanders/editorconfig.nvim (⭐325) - An EditorConfig plugin written in Fennel.
  • mhartington/formatter.nvim (⭐1.4k) - A format runner written in Lua.
  • MunifTanjim/prettier.nvim (⭐305) - Prettier integration.

Indent / Diagnostics

  • NMAC427/guess-indent.nvim (⭐517) - Automatic indentation style detection.
  • Darazaki/indent-o-matic (⭐195) - Dumb automatic fast indentation detection written in Lua.
  • yaocccc/nvim-hlchunk (⭐53) - Highlight a {} chunk.

Session / Diagnostics

  • rmagatti/auto-session (⭐1.6k) - A small automated session manager.

Tmux / Diagnostics

  • aserowy/tmux.nvim (⭐738) - Tmux integration features pane movement and resizing.

Boilerplate / Diagnostics

  • gennaro-tedesco/boilit (⭐83) - Create boilerplate structure plugins.

Resource / Diagnostics

  • Neovimcraft - A site dedicated to searching specific plugins and guides for building plugins in Lua.

items.title: Awesome Developer First
items.content_text:
### CI/CD

*   [Spacelift](https://spacelift.io/) - CI/CD platform for infrastructure-as-code, currently supporting Terraform, Pulumi, AWS CloudFormation, and Kubernetes.
items.content_html:
CI/CD

  • Spacelift - CI/CD platform for infrastructure-as-code, currently supporting Terraform, Pulumi, AWS CloudFormation, and Kubernetes.

items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Articles / Others

*   [Release: Blazorise 1.1.3](https://blazorise.com/news/release-notes/113) - November 8, 2022 - This Blazorise version was supposed to be just a minor maintenance release. Instead, we got a few relatively large features and announcements, with .NET 7 support.
items.content_html:
Articles / Others

  • Release: Blazorise 1.1.3 - November 8, 2022 - This Blazorise version was supposed to be just a minor maintenance release. Instead, we got a few relatively large features and announcements, with .NET 7 support.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Plugins / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [bat (⭐47)](https://github.com/fdellwing/zsh-bat) - Adds some helper aliases for [bat (⭐53k)](https://github.com/sharkdp/bat) users.

### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [funkydrac (⭐2)](https://github.com/warshanks/funkydrac) - Multiple Dracula-themed omz themes based on [funky (⭐180k)](https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/blob/master/themes/funky.zsh-theme) and an [oh-my-posh (⭐20k)](https://github.com/JanDeDobbeleer/oh-my-posh) theme based on [alien (⭐20k)](https://github.com/JanDeDobbeleer/oh-my-posh/blob/main/themes/aliens.omp.json)
items.content_html:
Plugins / superconsole - Windows-only

  • bat (⭐47) - Adds some helper aliases for bat (⭐53k) users.

Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • funkydrac (⭐2) - Multiple Dracula-themed omz themes based on funky (⭐180k) and an oh-my-posh (⭐20k) theme based on alien (⭐20k)
